t: Psalm 10
Why Do You Hide Yourself?
Why,*pn O Lord,*s do you stand far away? Why*ld do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
In*pn arrogance the wicked hotly pursue the poor; let*ld them be caught in the schemes that they have devised.
For*ln the wicked boasts of the desires of his soul, and*ld the one greedy for gain curses and renounces the Lord.*s
In*ln the pride of his face the wicked does not seek him; all*ld his thoughts are, “There is no God.”
His*ln ways prosper at all times; your*ld judgments are on high, out of his sight; as*ld for all his foes, he puffs at them.
He*ln says in his heart, “I shall not be moved; throughout*ld all generations I shall not meet adversity.”
His*ln mouth is filled with cursing and deceit and oppression; under*ld his tongue are mischief and iniquity.
He*ln sits in ambush in the villages; in*ld hiding places he murders the innocent. His*ln eyes stealthily watch for the helpless;
he*ld lurks in ambush like a lion in his thicket; he*ln lurks that he may seize the poor; he*ld seizes the poor when he draws him into his net.
The*ln helpless are crushed, sink down, and*ld fall by his might.
He*ln says in his heart, “God has forgotten, he*ld has hidden his face, he will never see it.”
Arise,*pn O Lord;*s O God, lift up your hand; forget*ld not the afflicted.
Why*ln does the wicked renounce God and*ld say in his heart, “You will not call to account”?
But*ln you do see, for you note mischief and vexation, that*ld you may take it into your hands; to*ln you the helpless commits himself; you*ld have been the helper of the fatherless.
Break*ln the arm of the wicked and evildoer; call*ld his wickedness to account till you find none.
The*pn Lord*s is king forever and ever; the*ld nations perish from his land.
O*ln Lord,*s you hear the desire of the afflicted; you*ld will strengthen their heart; you will incline your ear
to*ln do justice to the fatherless and the oppressed, so*ld that man who is of the earth may strike terror no more.
